Articles.Content:
I could've sworn I read in a devnote that 1.0 would introduce the ability to tweak the field of view by holding the mod key then the +- keys. This doesn't do anything. 

I would love to be able to get rid of the fish eye effect that KSP has had since day one. These tiny planets don't need to look any smaller then they already are.

- - - Updated - - -

And a thread was made just before this one, go figure. I looked, but I didn't see it. So it's the +- on the *numpab*? I'll have to give this a try. In the meantime a mod can remove the thread.

You can tweak the FOV by holding ALT then scrolling MMB also.

I didn't know about that one ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Yes as Redhotita1 says it's Mod+scroll, which is LeftAlt on Windows and RightShift on Linux/OS X.
